com.googlecode.aluminumproject.libraries.actions
Interface ActionContribution

public interface ActionContribution

Contributes to an action.

An action contribution has a number of different ways to contribute to an action. With the default options, the following choices are available:

  • The context in which the action is executed can be altered;
  • The action's parameters can be expanded;
  • The writer that the action will use can be replaced;
  • The action can be skipped altogether;
  • An interceptor can be added.
An action contribution is being created with a parameter. This parameter can be passed to the action, but it can also be used to base logic on (e.g. whether or not the action should be executed).

Method Summary
 boolean canBeMadeTo(ActionFactory actionFactory)
          Determines whether this action contribution can be made to a certain action.
 void make(Context context, Writer writer, ActionParameter parameter, ActionContributionOptions options)
          Makes this action contribution.
 

Method Detail

canBeMadeTo

boolean canBeMadeTo(ActionFactory actionFactory)
Determines whether this action contribution can be made to a certain action.

Parameters:
actionFactory - the factory that will create the action
Returns:
true if this action contribution can be made to the action that's created by the given action factory, false otherwise

make

void make(Context context,
          Writer writer,
          ActionParameter parameter,
          ActionContributionOptions options)
          throws ActionException,
                 ContextException
Makes this action contribution.

Parameters:
context - the context in which the action will be executed
writer - the writer that will be used for the action
parameter - the parameter with which this action contribution was created
options - the ways in which this action contribution can contribute to the action
Throws:
ActionException - when this action contribution can't be made
ContextException - when something goes wrong while using the context
